docs.title: Interactive Graph for Material for MkDocs
docs.text:
Plugin for Material for MkDocs to draw an interactive graph like Obsidian. The graph inside the sidebar is just available for non-mobile website. The modal view via the button next to the light/dark mode switch shall work on all devices.

Source code located on Github https://github.com/daxcore/mkdocs-obsidian-interactive-graph-plugin/.

The interactive graph based on the Apache ECharts open-source project. There is an example setup of the javascript available. Feel free to adapt to your needs.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
All necessary information to setup the project are available under Installation. The configuration for MkDocs is described under Setup.

It is also possible to use Docker for development reasons as well as for productive usage.

docs.title: Concept
docs.text: If you are interessted into the idea of the implementation, please have a look here Concept.

docs.title: References
docs.text: Also have a look at References that listed all projects used.

docs.title: JSON file
docs.text:
The python plugin for Material for MkDocs creates a graph.json file, which will be used by ECharts javascript.

You can find the JSON file for this example site here: graph.json

docs.title: Development
docs.text: Adapt the .env and mkdocs.yml files to your needs. DEV=ON will rebuild the mkdocs-obsidian-interactive-graph-plugin from local files.

docs.title: Productive
docs.text: If DEV != ON is set in mkdocs.yml the upstream packages of PyPI will be used.

docs.title: Start
docs.text: Build and start the Docker container via docker compose up --build [-d].

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Available on PyPI. Install via pip install mkdocs-obsidian-interactive-graph-plugin or add it to your requirements.txt.

docs.title: Graph Javascript by Apache ECharts
docs.text: A interactive_graph.js example can be downloaded from here and must be located into the docs directory under docs/ObsidianVault/assets/javascripts/interactive_graph.js.

docs.title: Live Editor
docs.text: There is a web-based live editor for the EChart javascript file: Live Editor

docs.title: Setup in MkDocs
docs.text:
Activate the plugin in mkdocs.yml, but note that this plugin has to be located before plugins, that replace wikilinks by markdown links. Currently just wikilinks like [[Link#Anchor|Custom Text]] are supported.

plugins:
  - obsidian-interactive-graph

extra_javascript:
  - https://fastly.jsdelivr.net/npm/jquery/dist/jquery.min.js
  - https://fastly.jsdelivr.net/npm/echarts/dist/echarts.min.js
  - assets/javascripts/interactive_graph.js

extra_css:
  - assets/stylesheets/interactive_graph.css
